info.description: An API which allows to retrieve data about the **Roman Calendar** for any given year, between 1970 and 9999. The data strives for historical accuracy (memorials and feast days are only generated from the year in which they were effectively introduced). The data is based on original sources (Roman Missals, Decrees of the Congregation for Divine Worship, Mysterii Paschalis, etc.), not on data copied or retrieved from online sources which may not be accurate. The API offers multiple locales and multiple calendars, from the **General Roman Calendar** to national or diocesan calendars.
info.title: Liturgical Calendar

tags.name: Main API endpoint
tags.description: All liturgical data is retrieved from this endpoint

get.summary: retrieves liturgical events for each day of the year
get.description: By passing in the appropriate options, you can retrieve data for the liturgical calendar for any given year

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: request the localization of the returned events in a specific language; will not be considered if a National calendar or diocesan calendar is requested

parameters.name: epiphany
parameters.description: indicates whether **Epiphany** should fall exactly on **January 6th** or instead on the **Sunday between January 2nd and January 8th**. Traditionally it falls on January 6th in the **Vatican**, but each regional Conference of Bishops can opt to celebrate on the Sunday.

parameters.name: ascension
parameters.description: indicates whether the feast of the **Ascension** should fall on a **Thursday** or on a **Sunday**. Traditionally in the **Vatican** it falls on a Thursday, but for pastoral reasons each regional Conference of Bishops can opt to celebrate on Sunday.

parameters.name: corpuschristi
parameters.description: indicates whether the feast of **Corpus Christi** should fall on a **Thursday** or on a **Sunday**. Traditionally in the **Vatican** it falls on a Thursday, but for pastoral reasons each regional Conference of Bishops can opt to celebrate on Sunday.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: indicates the year for which the liturgical calendar data is being requested. For the time being, this endpoint only calculates the Liturgical Calendar that follows the reform of the Second Vatican Council, starting from the publishing of the Editio Typica of the Roman Missal in 1970. Perhaps in future updates information from the calendar preceding the Second Vatican Council will be added, in order to have a greater historical range from the endpoint. ***If not indicated will default to the current year.***

parameters.name: returntype
parameters.description: indicates the format of the data that will be returned by the endpoint. N.B. the desired data type should also be detected from the Accept header set by the requesting client, if not indicated by means of the returntype parameter

parameters.name: nationalcalendar
parameters.description: requests liturgical calendar data for a particular geographic area, on a national level or according to specifications defined be one or more Episcopal Conferences or on a Roman Missal published for a certain language or geographic area.

parameters.name: diocesancalendar
parameters.description: requests liturgical calendar data for a particular diocese

parameters.name: calendartype
parameters.description: indicates whether the API should calculate a calendar for the solar year (Jan 1 - Dec 31) or the liturgical year (First Sunday of Advent of the preceding year including vigil Mass - Saturday of the 34th week of Ordinary Time)

parameters.name: eternalhighpriest
parameters.description: indicates whether the festivity of Jesus Christ Eternal High Priest should apply to the current calendar (may be overriden by national calendar settings)

200.description: OK: liturgical events for a given year according to the requested criteria

X-LitCal-Starttime.description: High resolution timestamp in nanoseconds that indicates the start time of the calculation of the current liturgical calendar response

X-LitCal-Endtime.description: High resolution timestamp in nanoseconds that indicates the end time of the calculation of the current liturgical calendar response

X-LitCal-Executiontime.description: Total time in nanoseconds in which the calculation of the current liturgical calendar response was produced (difference between X-LitCal-Starttime and X-LitCal-Endtime, average is usually about 5ms!)

X-LitCal-Generated.description: Indicates whether the current response was produced from: a fresh calculation since the response to the given request had not yet been calculated, or from client cache since the response has not changed since last request, or from server cache since the client had not yet made this same request but the calculation had already been done formerly on the server

304.description: Not Modified: client should use cached results seeing that the response has not changed

400.description: Bad Request: invalid parameters or malformed data in request body

406.description: Not Acceptable: Accept header requests a response Content Type which this API cannot produce

415.description: Unsupported Media Type: Content Type of request not valid

418.description: I'm a teapot: request in this case must be an AJAX request, but AJAX request not detected

LitCal.description: the liturgical events that make up the requested Liturgical Calendar for the given year

eventIdx.description: progressive index, one for each liturgical event. Not really very useful. The key that identifies the liturgical event is more useful.

name.description: the name of the Liturgical Event, localized according to the requested locale or the requested calendar (will be in English for the national USA calendar, Italian for the national Italian calendar, etc.)

date.description: a PHP style unix timestamp (seconds from the Unix Epoch) in UTC time. The time should be a zero value seeing that we deal only with all day events, and time is not of importance. For use in Javascript, multiply this value by 1000, because Javascript uses milliseconds as a base for timestamps, whereas PHP uses seconds. The timestamp value should be dealt with accordingly in each programming language used, as is if the language uses seconds as a base, or multiplying by 1000 if it uses milliseconds as a base.

color.description: the liturgical color used for the current liturgical event. The color name is CSS ready, therefore it will always be in English.

colorLcl.description: Liturgical colors associated with the current liturgical event, localized according to the current locale.

type.description: whether the liturgical event is a fixed or a mobile festivity

grade.description: The logical importance or rank of the current liturgical event, represented as a number from 0 to 7, used to calculate precedence compared to other possible events. The importance or precedence value will determine whether one event may suppress another event or have it moved to the next possible open slot according to certain criteria. A general association with liturgical terminology would be as follows * 0 = WEEKDAY * 1 = COMMEMORATION * 2 = OPTIONAL MEMORIAL * 3 = MEMORIAL * 4 = FEAST * 5 = FEAST OF THE LORD * 6 = SOLEMNITY * 7 = event that has precedence over a solemnity However this association is not suitable for displaying the actual *grade* (or *rank*) of the festivity in liturgical terms, because some events have a logical importance that does not correspond with their portrayed grade, for example "All Souls Day" is called a "Commemoration" and yet it is given the same importance as a solemnity. Thus "All Souls Day" will have a grade of 6, but should be displayed as "Commemoration" rather than as "Solemnity". Therefore the ***displayGrade*** property should be checked first, and if empty then the above indicated association should be valid and can be used

gradeLcl.description: Logical importance or rank of the current liturgical event, localized according to the current locale

displayGrade.description: will often be empty, in which case the numeric ***grade*** property can be used to identify the liturgical rank, or the localized ***gradeLcl*** string can be used, for the purpose of displaying the rank of the current liturgical event. If non empty, will contain the localized rank of the liturgical event and should be used instead of the grade property or the gradeLcl property for display purposes; see for example "All Souls Day" which logically is treated like a SOLEMNITY but displays as a "Commemoration"

common.description: if the current liturgical event commemorates a saint, this value if non empty will indicate whether the readings are to be taken from the Proper of Saints (in which case it will have a value of "Proper") or from one of the Commons. In the latter case, if there is more than one possible common, the multiple possible commons will be listed as a comma separated list. Each common can be further specified by a particular category, in which case the specific category within the common will be separated from the common by a colon. Since we are dealing with a logical data structure the values are not localized, localization should be handled by the requesting application

commonLcl.description: Common used (if applicable) for the current liturgical event, localized according to the current locale

dayOfTheWeek_ISO8601.description: ISO 8601 representation of the day of the week, 1 for Monday, 7 for Sunday

month.description: Numeric representation of the month of the current liturgical event, 1 for January, 12 for December

day.description: Numeric representation of the day of the month of the current liturgical event

year.description: Numeric representation of the year for the current liturgical event

monthShort.description: Short form of the month for the current liturgical event, localized according to the current locale

monthLong.description: Long form of the month for the current liturgical event, localized according to the current locale

dayOfTheWeekShort.description: Short form of the day of the month for the current liturgical event, localized according to the current locale

dayOfTheWeekLong.description: Long form of the day of the month for the current liturgical event, localized according to the current locale

liturgicalYear.description: Liturgical cycle localized according to the current locale (or national calendar). This property will only be present for events where it is applicable (Sundays or weekdays of Ordinary Time, Solemnities, Feasts of the Lord, in practice those liturgical events the texts of which are based on the liturgical cycle). When present, it will have a localized value of `YEAR A`, `YEAR B`, or `YEAR C` for festive events or a value of `YEAR I`, `YEAR II` for weekday events (whereas if an application makes a request for the Italian language or the national Italian calendar, the values will contain `ANNO` instead of `YEAR`, and similarly for any other localization requested).

liturgicalSeason.description: Liturgical season that the current liturgical event falls in. Is not present for Vigil Mass events, however in this case it can be retrieved from the 'parent' event using the `isVigilFor` property

liturgicalSeasonLcl.description: Liturgical season that the current liturgical event falls in, localized according to the current locale

isVigilMass.description: `true` if the current liturgical event is a Vigil Mass, `false` if not

hasVigilMass.description: this property will be present for applicable events such as Solemnities or Sundays. Will have a boolean value of `true` if the expected Vigil Mass is confirmed, and of `false` if the expected Vigil Mass is superseded by another liturgical event. Sometimes this will be established from year to year for specific coincidences by the Congregation for Divine Worship.

isVigilFor.description: `name` of the corresponding liturgical event for which the current liturgical event is a Vigil Mass

hasVesperI.description: this property will be present for applicable events such as Solemnities or Sundays. Will have a boolean value of `true` if the expected First Vespers are confirmed, and of `false` if the expected First Vespers are superseded by another liturgical event. Sometimes this will be established from year to year for specific coincidences by the Congregation for Divine Worship.

hasVesperII.description: this property will be present for applicable events such as Solemnities or Sundays. Will have a boolean value of `true` if the expected Second Vespers are confirmed, and of `false` if the expected Second Vespers are superseded by another liturgical event. Sometimes this will be established from year to year for specific coincidences by the Congregation for Divine Worship.

psalterWeek.description: Psalter week in which the current liturgical event falls, if applicable

Settings.description: echoes back the settings that were requested for the generation of this specific liturgical calendar, as feedback to be sure that the requested settings were correctly applied

Epiphany.description: whether Epiphany is set to be celebrated on January 6th or on the Sunday between January 2nd and January 8th

Ascension.description: whether Ascension is set to be celebrated on Thursday or on Sunday

CorpusChristi.description: whether Corpus Christi is set to be celebrated on Thursday or on Sunday

LitCalTestsIndex.description: the keys of this object identify the Unit Test, and follow the pattern `{TestName}Test`

testType.description:
* `exactCorrespondence`: the test or tests will only be performed against the years defined in the `expectedValues` array, and the only assertions for this test will be found in the `assertions` object with a one to one correspondence to the years defined in the `expectedValues` array; in this case the `yearsOther` key will have a `null` value
* `exactCorrespondenceSince`: the test or tests will not only test against the years defined in the `expectedValues` array, but will also handle any year prior to the first year defined in the `expectedValues` array; in this case the `yearsOther` object will have a `before` key
* `variableCorrespondence`: different tests with different assertions will be performed depending on the year that the test is being performed against. Definite expected date values for when the festivity should exist will be defined in the `expectedValues` array; any other years that might be tested with assertions of their own (usually for non existence of the festivity in a given year) might be defined in the `yearsOther` object

additionalProperties.description: text description of the assertion which if true will validate the test

yearsOther.description: value will be `null` in the case of an `exactCorrespondence` type test; otherwise an object

before.description: assertion being made for any years prior to the first year defined in the `expectedValues` array; this key can only be present in the case of an `exactCorrespondenceSince` type test

additionalProperties.description: assertions for any other years that fall outside of the `expectedValues` array; these keys will only be present in the case of a `variableCorrespondence` type test
